name: concrete production, 20MPa, self-construction, for building construction, with cement, type general use | concrete, 20MPa | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21830/documentation

This dataset represents the production of Colombian 20MPself-construction concrete for buidling construction and gereral use. Density: 2'334 kg/m続 - w/c: 0.67. Ingredients (for 1 m続): Cement type UG Type 350 kg, Water 235 kg, Gravel 1050 kg, Sand 700kg.

From reception of raw materials at the construction site.

This activity ends after concrete mixing at the construction site. 

The dataset includes the whole manufacturing processes to produce self-construction concrete, but does not include the on site mixing infrastrucutre. 

Concrete losses of 3% are considered.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2395:Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The production volume of 2016 is considered. The data from sustainability reports goes from 2014 to 2016. Data have been reported with the production volume of corresponding year.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Representative production of self-construction concrete 20 MPa with GU type cemen int Colombia. Data based from main cement producers and personal comunications with local experts.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Represent the current technology for self-construction concrete production in Colombia.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The main values are considered representative for a typical production of self-construction concrete for building construction in Colombia.

The infrastrucutre is included and the main emissions to water and some inputs are taken from the global dataset for ready-mix concrete production (20MPa).

The auxiliary material (rubber, lube oil) are based on a sampling of 34 concrete plants in Brazil.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The 1:2:3  concrete recipe is considered as the most commonly used mix design for self-construction in Colombia, based on personal communication with the Colombian concrete association (Ing. Pimentel, 2017). 

Unit flows were calculated by dividing the amounts of inputs and outputs by the total concrete production in mass.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Calculated value. The water balance is established taking into account the total water input (withdrawal) minus the outputs, which include the water contained in the concrete, the water evaporated and the water infiltrated. In general, no waste water is produced. The water incorporated in the concrete correspond to the cement amount multiplied by w/c ratio. The share of the water evaporated to air and the water infiltrated is calculated based on the sustainability reports from Argos (60% evaporated).

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. the average consumption of electricity has been estimated by measuring the average specifications of concrete mixers commonly used in building sites. An average concrete mixer produces 200l (0.2m3). The power of the motor is around 2kW and production capacity of 2.4m3/h (Various, 2017). The electricity consumption is then 0.833 kWh/m3 of concrete.
EcoSpold01Location=CH

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The water balance is established taking into account the total water input (withdrawal) minus the outputs, which include the water contained in the concrete, the water evaporated and the water infiltrated. In general, no waste water is produced. The water incorporated in the concrete correspond to the cement amount multiplied by w/c ratio. The share of the water evaporated to air and the water infiltrated is calculated based on the sustainability reports from Argos (60% evaporated).

Estimated value. Confirmed by local experts from association (Dir, Lascarro, Ing Pimentel, Asocreto, 2017) and biggest ready-mix plant from Holcim in Bogota (Holcim, 2017)

Holcim. (2017). Visit of Concrete facility - Holcim Puente Aranda. Bogota.
